welcome.subtitle: Your trusted emergency companion
welcome.description: With one tap, connect to help, alert loved ones, and protect your rights — wherever you are.

intro1.description: “We’ve lived the fear, the uncertainty, and the silence when help felt out of reach. We’ve seen our communities targeted, our rights stripped away, and our loved ones disappear without warning.”

intro2.quote: “We built this app as an act of resistance and care — a way to protect each other when the systems around us won’t. It’s a lifeline born from love, urgency, and the deep belief that our people deserve safety, dignity, and the power to act when it matters most.”

tutorial.description-1: We'll only use these to alert your loved ones when you hit the panic button.
tutorial.description-2: So we can connect you to local help and nearby immigration resources.
tutorial.point-3: 3. In an emergency, tap the big red button.
tutorial.description-3: We’ll instantly send a message with your location to your trusted contacts and local rapid response teams.
tutorial.description-4: Know your rights and show them in your preferred language — even during stressful moments.

main.right-1: I do not wish to speak with you. I am exercising my right to remain silent, based on my Fifth Amendment right under the U.S. Constitution, which protects me from being forced to incriminate myself.
main.right-2: I do not give you permission to enter my home, based on my Fourth Amendment right, which protects me against unreasonable searches and requires a valid warrant signed by a judge.
main.right-3: I do not consent to a search of my belongings, my home, or my person. This is also based on my Fourth Amendment right, which states that I cannot be searched without a warrant or legal justification.
main.right-4: I want to speak to a lawyer before answering any questions. This is my Sixth Amendment right, which guarantees me access to legal counsel if I am being questioned or detained.
main.right-5: I choose to exercise my constitutional rights
